#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Cromer
#Text=Cromer is a town on the North Norfolk coast famous for its crabs , fishermen and lifeboats .
#Text=The North Norfolk coast is one of the most rapidly eroding coastlines in Europe .
#Text=A thousand years ago Cromer was inland ( ' Crow Mere ' - the lake of crows - seen on the town 's coat of arms ) , and the coastal village was called Shipden .
#Text=This is now several hundred metres out to sea .
#Text=Modern Cromer is a mélange of architectural styles .
#Text=Everything from charming brick-and-flint and stately Georgian , to 1960s carbuncular to modern bungalows and caravan sites .

#Text=But the heyday was the 19th century , as witnessed by several streets of tall townhouses ( now mainly B&B hotels ) , the growth stimulated by the coming of the railways and when the popularity of the town and environs was raised by the writings of Clement Scott .
#Text=Get in
#Text=The drive from Norwich on the A140 takes about 35-40 minutes .
#Text=This is a much more dangerous road than it appears - at harvest time especially you should watch for farm vehicles emerging from side roads .
#Text=Alternatively you might try the train .
#Text=The Bittern Line is allegedly one of the great railway journeys of the world .
#Text=Leaving Norwich , it crosses the broads via Salhouse , Hoveton & Wroxham ( change for the wee Bure Valley railway to Aylsham ) , Worstead , North Walsham , Gunton and Cromer .
#Text=The line extends to West Runton and Sheringham , where it joins up with the North Norfolk steam railway to Holt .
#Text=You can also get to Cromer quite easily by bus from Norwich .
#Text=The Coast Hopper operates throughout the year runs to Wells next the Sea with connections to Hunstanton .
#Text=This is a great way to explore the coast .
#Text=As you go west along the coast , especially after Sheringham , each village is more picturesque than the last .
#Text=Lots of barn conversions and vernacular brick-and-flint architecture .
#Text=By air , the nearest airport is at Norwich .
#Text=By bicycle
#Text=Regional Cycle Route 30 goes through the town .
#Text=On foot
#Text=Norfolk Coast Path .
#Text=A long distance ( 63 miles ) footpath originally ending at Cromer ( running westwards to Hunstanton ) but the path now run westwards to Sea Palling .
#Text=Links to the Peddlars
#Text=Way long distance footpath near Hunstanton
#Text=The Weavers ' Way ( 56 miles ) ling distance footpath runs to the town from Great Yarmouth .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Cromer is 23 miles from the centre of Norwich , and is a good base for exploring the north coast of Norfolk .

#Text=Cromer is on several main roads - to Norwich , Holt , along the coast to Sheringham to the west and Overstrand to the west - it can get congested in the town centre especially during the summer months .
#Text=Although Cromer bustles at all times of the year it is much busier in the summer , especially during Carnival Week in mid-August .
#Text=There are several car parks inside the town , all of which are pay-and-display .
#Text=Competition for the few free parking bays is fierce .
#Text=On the 1st and 3rd Friday of each month , Cromer 's Market is held inside the Meadow Car Park , reducing the number of available spaces .
#Text=In Cromer and in general in East Anglia , bringing or hiring a car is highly recommended as the area has many small villages and towns separated by long country roads .
#Text=There are quite a few reasonably good local bus companies ( Sanders is the main one ) and although Cromer is remarkably hilly for Norfolk , cycling is a good way to get around .
#Text=See
#Text=The Lighthouse , Overstrand Rd , Cromer , NR27 0JH .
#Text=A pleasant walk eastwards from the town centre and affords fine views .
#Text=Amazona Zoo , Hall Road , Cromer , NR27 9JG , ☏ +441263510741 , ✉ hello@amazonazoo.co.uk . 10:00 - 17:00 ( last admission 16:00 ) .
#Text=View and learn about a wide variety of animals from South America .
#Text=Cafe and Gift Shop on site . £11.50 ( adult ) .
#Text=£8.50 ( child ) ( other options ) .
#Text=Cromer Beach , Runton Rd , Cromer , NR27 9HP .
#Text=The beach at Cromer is public and free to access and rated very highly .
#Text=The West Beach ( west of the pier ) is more built up , with toilets , a shop and a funfair .
#Text=The East Beach ( east of the pier ) has fewer amenities .
#Text=Walking east along the shore , you 'll soon be out of the main tourist orbit , and even in the summer holidays you can have huge stretches of beautiful beach more or less to yourself .
#Text=Even in winter it has a rugged grandeur .
#Text=The most notable beach fauna is the edible crab ( Carcinus edulis ) , served when available in local cafés and restaurants .
#Text=Crab boats can be seen launching and returning with their catch .
#Text=Cromer Museum , East Cottages , Tucker Street , Cromer , NR27 9HB ( near the church ) , ☏ +441263513543 , ✉ cromer.museum@norfolk.gov.uk .
#Text=The Cromer Museum is housed in several converted fishermen 's cottages , and includes many interesting and picturesque arcana of local and town life .
#Text=It also includes a few scraps of the famous West Runton Elephant .
#Text=Some of the rest of this enormous fossil beast can be found in the Norwich Castle museum .
#Text=There are also displays of local lore and legend including the Black Shuck .
#Text=Cromer Pier and Pavilion Theatre , ☏ +441263512495 .
#Text=Cromer Pier is one of the oldest in the country and has been damaged and restored several times .
#Text=The Pavilion Theatre at the end of the pier runs a Seaside Special variety show during the summer season ( June 21 to September 20 in 2014 ) , and also around Christmas .
#Text=There is lots of other entertainment throughout the year from ballet to variety to blues and folk and rock .
#Text=Check the web-site for dates , times , prices , and tickets .
#Text=Fireworks on the pier are a highlight on 1 January and in Carnival Week , and the pier is a good place to stand when observing the traditional Boxing Day Swim on 26 December .
#Text=Beyond the theatre is the new lifeboat station .
#Text=The old one is on shore , next to the Henry Blogg RNLI lifeboat museum .
#Text=RNLI Henry Blogg Museum ( Cromer Lifeboat Museum ) , The Rocket House , The Gangway , Cromer , NR27 9ET , ☏ +441263511294 , ✉ blogg_museum@rnli.org.uk .
#Text=10am to 4pm February to early December .
#Text=Learn about the courageous lifesavers .
#Text=See one of the lifesaving boats .
#Text=Free .
#Text=Felbrigg Hall , Gardens and Estate , Felbrigg , NR11 8PR , ☏ +441263837444 , ✉ felbrigg@nationaltrust.org.uk .
#Text=Cromer Church , Church St , Cromer , NR27 9HH .
#Text=Like many Norfolk churches , it is much vaster than would seem to be necessary .
#Text=Much of it was restored after partial destruction by a World War II bomb .
#Text=The view from the tower is , reputedly , extensive .
